    VMASC Virginia Data Cube

    Welcome to the VMASC Virginia Open Data Cube Hub!

    The VMASC VA Data Cube is a powerful geospatial analytical tool that aids in managing and organizing imagery data with its respective time series data for easier analysis. The VA Data Cube capabilities can be utilized to provide insight and information for future-focused environmental, economic, or public health decisions based on past data, or a multitude of other problem solving possibilities.

    The abilities of the Data Cube are more impactful with the help of the geospatial research community comprised of data providers, problem owners, and data analysts coming together to provide additional resources, data, and tools to solve real-world problems. This is the main reason the VMASC Virginia Data Cube was created, to provide a platform for ODU Researchers, Data Scientist, and students to explore and make informed decisions around free and open satellite data for Virginia.

    Open Data Cube

    The VMASC Virginia Data Cube utilizes The Open Data Cube (ODC) which is an Open Source Geospatial Data Management and Analysis Software that helps users harness the power of Satellite data.

    Read more

    VMASC Virginia Data Cube - AWS Cloud

    The VMASC Virginia Data Cube is currently hosted on AWS Cloud and has the ability to quickly scale up/down based on project requirements.

    Supported by NASA AIST-21 grant 'Pixels for Public Health'

    Along with supporting the VMASC Virginia Open Data Cube, the ‘Pixels for Public Health’ grant is developng digital twin technologies for building healthy, resilient, and equitable communities. You can find out more about the initiative at the link below.

    Read more

    NOTE: The Virginia Data Cube is undergoing constant upgrades and maintenance. If you are having issues acccessing please email Datacube@odu.edu
